subject: Extra axis causing trouble
description_text:
Hi, good morning,

I got new pedals from the official store from Aliexpress (order
8205296233924418). They are Simsonn Pro X ultra P3-H3.

I have a small, possibly software related issue not related to the pedals.

There is a 4th axis "flickering" or "unstable". So when I try to
assign the regular axes I have trouble because this 4th axis "takes
over" the pulsation from axis I am pressing (throttle, brake or
clutch).

This flickering is generated from the control box. I can tell because
I can see it "flickering" even when I unplug the pedals. It is also
not OS dependent (ex. driver), because I also tested from Linux, and
this is what I get:

# jstest /dev/input/js0
Driver version is 2.1.0.
Joystick (SIMSONN SIMSONN Pro X Ultra) has 4 axes (X, Y, Z, Rx)
and 0 buttons ().
Testing ... (interrupt to exit)
Axes:  0:-32767  1:-32767  2:-32767  3:  1126

The issue is with the 4th axis/button (number 3), it alternates
quickly from 0 to 1126.

I upgraded the firmware from the official software before I even
tested the pedals, so I don't know if it was being generated with the
previous version.

It only causes trouble when I assign the buttons, when I play any
game, I do not have that axis assigned to anything so it does not
bother at all.

Any ideas about how to solve it? It is annoying when I set the
controls, and it drove me crazy until I found out what was going on.

I searched how to block this unwanted button/axis and found I could do
it with vjoy, but I am not sure if it will break other things such as
curves or pressure.


Hope you can help me. Other than this pedals are amazing.

Cheers, Jose

conversations.body_text:
Hello,

this fixed it :). I only had to use the sfu version for the ultra pedals.

Thanks a lot.

Have a good day.
